snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo could make the party, which survives on confusion, lose its place on the state ballot in New York by rejecting its endorsement.
abstract: Editorial urges New York Gov Andrew Cuomo to reject endorsement of New York Independence Party, which would remove bizarre and fractious group from state ballot; notes that Rob Astorino, Republican who is challenging Cuomo's re-election, has said he will not seek or accept party's endorsement; contends that party survives on confusion, courting many voters who mistakenly believe they are registering as independents.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo could make the party, which survives on confusion, lose its place on the state ballot in New York by rejecting its endorsement.
